slokas: धृतराष्ट्र उवाचधर्मक्षेत्रे कुरुक्षेत्रे समवेता युयुत्सव: ।मामका: पाण्डवाश्चैव किमकुर्वत सञ्जय ॥ १ ॥
slokas_translated: The King Dhritarashtra asked: “O Sanjaya! What happened on the sacred battlefield of Kurukshetra, when my people gathered against the Pandavas?”

slokas: सञ्जय उवाचदृष्ट्वा तु पाण्डवानीकं व्यूढं दुर्योधनस्तदा ।आचार्यमुपसङ्गम्य राजा वचनमब्रवीत्  ॥  २ ॥
slokas_translated: Sanjaya replied: “The Prince Duryodhana, when he saw the army of the Pandavas paraded, approached his preceptor Guru Drona and spoke as follows:

slokas: पश्यैतां पाण्डुपुत्राणामाचार्य महतीं चमूम् ।व्यूढां द्रुपदपुत्रेण तव शिष्येण धीमता ॥ ३ ॥
slokas_translated: Revered Father! Behold this mighty host of the Pandavas, paraded by the son of King Drupada, your wise disciple.

slokas: अत्र श‍ूरा महेष्वासा भीमार्जुनसमा युधि ।युयुधानो विराटश्च द्रुपदश्च महारथः ॥ ४ ॥
slokas_translated: In it are heroes and great bowmen; the equals in battle of Arjuna and Bheema, Yuyudhana, Virata and Drupada, great soldiers all;

slokas: धृष्टकेतुश्चेकितानः काशिराजश्च वीर्यवान् ।पुरुजित्कुन्तिभोजश्च शैब्यश्च नरपुङ्गवः ॥ ५ ॥
slokas_translated: Dhrishtaketu, Chekitan, the valiant King of Benares, Purujit, Kuntibhoja, Shaibya – a master over many;

slokas: युधामन्युश्च विक्रान्त उत्तमौजाश्च वीर्यवान् ।सौभद्रो द्रौपदेयाश्च सर्व एव महारथाः ॥ ६ ॥
slokas_translated: Yudhamanyu, Uttamouja, Soubhadra and the sons of Droupadi, famous men.

slokas: अस्माकं तु विशिष्टा ये तान्निबोध द्विजोत्तम ।नायका मम सैन्यस्य संज्ञार्थ तान्ब्रवीमि ते ॥ ७ ॥
slokas_translated: Further, take note of all those captains who have ranged themselves on our side, O best of Spiritual Guides! The leaders of my army. I will name them for you.

slokas: भवान्भीष्मश्च कर्णश्च कृपश्च समितिंजयः ।अश्वत्थामा विकर्णश्च सौमदत्तिस्तथैव च ॥ ८ ॥
slokas_translated: You come first; then Bheeshma, Karna, Kripa, great soldiers; Ashwaththama, Vikarna and the son of Somadhatta;

slokas: अन्ये च बहवः श‍ूरा मदर्थे त्यक्तजीविताः ।नानाशस्त्रप्रहरणाः सर्वे युद्धविशारदाः ॥ ९ ॥
slokas_translated: And many others, all ready to die for my sake; all armed, all skilled in war.

slokas: अपर्याप्त‍ं तदस्माकं बलं भीष्माभिरक्षितम् ।पर्याप्त‍ं त्विदमेतेषां बलं भीमाभिरक्षितम् ॥ १० ॥
slokas_translated: Yet our army seems the weaker, though commanded by Bheeshma; their army seems the stronger, though commanded by Bheema.

slokas: अयनेषु च सर्वेषु यथाभागवमस्थिताः ।भीष्ममेवाभिरक्षन्तु भवन्तः सर्व एव हि ॥ ११ ॥
slokas_translated: Therefore in the rank and file, let stand firm in their posts, according to battalions; and all you generals about Bheeshma.

slokas: तस्य सञ्जनयन्हर्षं कुरुवृद्धः पितामहः ।सिंहनादं विनद्योच्च‍ैः शङ्खं दध्मौ प्रतापवान् ॥ १२ ॥
slokas_translated: Then to enliven his spirits, the brave Grandfather Bheeshma, eldest of the Kuru-clan, blew his conch, till it sounded like a lion’s roar.

slokas: ततः शङ्खाश्च भेर्यश्च पणवानकगोमुखाः ।सहसैवाभ्यहन्यन्त स शब्दस्तुमुलोऽभवत् ॥ १३ ॥
slokas_translated: And immediately all the conches and drums, the trumpets and horns, blared forth in tumultuous uproar.

slokas: ततः श्वेतैर्हयैर्युक्ते महति स्यन्दने स्थितौ ।माधवः पाण्डवश्चैव दिव्यौ शङ्खौ प्रदध्मतुः ॥ १४ ॥
slokas_translated: Then seated in their spacious war chariot, yoked with white horses, Lord Shri Krishna and Arjuna sounded their divine shells.

slokas: पाञ्चजन्यं हृषीकेशो देवदत्तं धनञ्जयः ।पौण्ड्रं दध्मौ महाशङ्खं भीमकर्मा वृकोदरः ॥ १५ ॥
slokas_translated: Lord Shri Krishna blew his Panchajanya and Arjuna his Devadatta, brave Bheema his renowned shell, Poundra.

slokas: अनन्तविजयं राजा कुन्तीपुत्रो युधिष्ठिरः ।नकुलः सहदेवश्च सुघोषमणिपुष्पकौ ॥ १६ ॥
slokas_translated: The King Dharmaraja, the son of Kunti, blew the Anantavijaya, Nakalu and Sahadeo, the Sugosh and Manipushpaka, respectively.

slokas: काश्यश्च परमेष्वास: शिखण्डी च महारथ: ।धृष्टद्युम्न‍ो विराटश्च सात्यकिश्‍चापराजित: ॥ १७ ॥
slokas_translated: And the Maharaja of Benares, the great archer, Shikhandi, the great soldier, Dhrishtayumna, Virata and Satyaki, the invincible,

slokas: द्रुपदो द्रौपदेयाश्च सर्वश: पृथिवीपते ।सौभद्रश्च महाबाहु: शङ्खान्दध्मु: पृथक्पृथक् ॥ १८ ॥
slokas_translated: And O King! Drupada, the sons of Droupadi and Soubhadra, the great soldier, blew their conches.

slokas: स घोषो धार्तराष्ट्राणां हृदयानि व्यदारयत् ।नभश्च पृथिवीं चैव तुमुलोऽभ्यनुनादयन् ॥ १९ ॥
slokas_translated: The tumult rent the hearts of the sons of Dhritarashtra, and violently shook heaven and earth with its echo.

slokas: अथ व्यवस्थितान्दृष्ट्वा धार्तराष्ट्रान्कपिध्वजः ।प्रवृत्ते शस्त्रसम्पाते धनुरुद्यम्य पाण्डवः ।हृषीकेशं तदा वाक्यमिदमाह महीपते ॥ २० ॥
slokas_translated: Then beholding the sons of Dhritarashtra, drawn up on the battle- field, ready to fight, Arjuna, whose flag bore the Hanuman,

slokas: अर्जुन उवाचसेनयोरुभयोर्मध्ये रथं स्थापय मेऽच्युत ।यावदेतान्निरीक्षेऽहं योद्‍धुकामानवस्थितान् ॥ २१ ॥
slokas_translated: Raising his bow, spoke this to the Lord Shri Krishna: O Infallible! Lord of the earth! Please draw up my chariot between the two armies,

slokas: कैर्मया सह योद्धव्यमस्मिन्‍रणसमुद्यमे ॥ २२ ॥
slokas_translated: So that I may observe those who must fight on my side, those who must fight against me;

slokas: योत्स्यमानानवेक्षेऽहं य एतेऽत्र समागताः ।धार्तराष्ट्रस्य दुर्बुद्धेर्युद्धे प्रियचिकीर्षवः ॥ २३ ॥
slokas_translated: And gaze over this array of soldiers, eager to please the sinful sons of Dhritarashtra.”

slokas: सञ्जय उवाचएवमुक्तो हृषीकेशो गुडाकेशेन भारत ।सेनयोरुभयोर्मध्ये स्थापयित्वा रथोत्तमम् ॥ २४ ॥
slokas_translated: Sanjaya said: “Having listened to the request of Arjuna, Lord Shri Krishna drew up His bright chariot exactly in the midst between the two armies,

slokas: भीष्मद्रोणप्रमुखतः सर्वेषां च महीक्षिताम्  ।उवाच पार्थ पश्यैतान्समवेतान्कुरुनिति ॥ २५ ॥
slokas_translated: Where Bheeshma and Drona had led all the rulers of the earth, and spoke thus: O Arjuna! Behold these members of the family of Kuru assembled.

slokas: तत्रापश्यत्स्थितान्पार्थः पितॄनथ पितामहान्।आचार्यान्मातुलान्भ्रातॄन्पुत्रान्पौत्रान्सखींस्तथा।श्वश‍ुरान्सुहृदश्चैव सेनयोरुभयोरपि ॥ २६ ॥
slokas_translated: There Arjuna noticed fathers, grandfathers, uncles, cousins, sons, grandsons, teachers, friends;   Fathers-in-law and benefactors, arrayed on both sides. Arjuna then gazed at all those kinsmen before him.

slokas: तान्समीक्ष्य स कौन्तेयः सर्वान्बन्धूनवस्थितान्  ।कृपया परयाविष्टो विषीदन्निदमब्रवीत् ॥ २७ ॥
slokas_translated: And his heart melted with pity and sadly he spoke: O my Lord! When I see all these, my own people, thirsting for battle,

slokas: अर्जुन उवाचदृष्ट्वेमं स्वजनं कृष्ण युयुत्सुं समुपस्थितम्  ।सीदन्ति मम गात्राणि मुखं च परिश‍ुष्यति ॥ २८ ॥
slokas_translated: My limbs fail me and my throat is parched, my body trembles and my hair stands on end.

slokas: वेपथुश्च शरीरे मे रोमहर्षश्च जायते ।गाण्डीवं स्रंसते हस्तात्त्वक्च‍ैव परिदह्यते ॥ २९ ॥
slokas_translated: The bow Gandeeva slips from my hand, and my skin burns. I cannot keep quiet, for my mind is in tumult.

slokas: न च शक्न‍ोम्यवस्थातुं भ्रमतीव च मे मनः ।निमित्तानि च पश्यामि विपरीतानि केशव ॥ ३० ॥
slokas_translated: The omens are adverse; what good can come from the slaughter of my people on this battlefield?

slokas: न च श्रेयोऽनुपश्यामि हत्वा स्वजनमाहवे ।न काङ्क्षे विजयं कृष्ण न च राज्यं सुखानि च ॥ ३१ ॥
slokas_translated: Ah my Lord! I crave not for victory, nor for the kingdom, nor for any pleasure. What were a kingdom or happiness or life to me,

slokas: किं नो राज्येन गोविन्द किं भोगैर्जीवितेन वा ।येषामर्थे काङ्‍‍क्षितं नो राज्यं भोगाः सुखानि च ॥ ३२  ॥
slokas_translated: When those for whose sake I desire these things stand here about to sacrifice their property and their lives:

slokas: त इमेऽवस्थिता युद्धे प्राणांस्त्यक्त्वा धनानि च ।आचार्याः पितरः पुत्रास्तथैव च पितामहाः ॥ ३3॥
slokas_translated: Teachers, fathers and grandfathers, sons and grandsons, uncles, father-in-law, brothers-inlaw and other relatives.

slokas: मातुलाः श्वश‍ुराः पौत्राः श्यालाः सम्बन्धिनस्तथा ।एतान्न हन्तुमिच्छामि घ्न‍तोऽपि मधुसूदन ॥ ३४ ॥
slokas_translated: I would not kill them, even for three worlds; why then for this poor earth? It matters not if I myself am killed.

slokas: अपि त्रैलोक्यराज्यस्य हेतोः किं नु महीकृते ।निहत्य धार्तराष्ट्रान्नः का प्रीतिः स्याज्ज‍नार्दन ॥ ३५ ॥
slokas_translated: My Lord! What happiness can come from the death of these sons of Dhritarashtra? We shall sin if we kill these desperate men.

slokas: पापमेवाश्रयेदस्मान्हत्वैतानाततायिनः ।तस्मान्नार्हा वयं हन्तुं धार्तराष्ट्रान्सबान्धवान् ।स्वजनं हि कथं हत्वा सुखिनः स्याम माधव ॥ ३६ ॥
slokas_translated: We are worthy of a nobler feat than to slaughter our relatives – the sons of Dhritarashtra; for, my Lord, how can we be happy of we kill our kinsmen?

slokas: यद्यप्येते न पश्यन्ति लोभोपहतचेतसः ।कुलक्षयकृतं दोषं मित्रद्रोहे च पातकम् ॥ ३७
slokas_translated: Although these men, blinded by greed, see no guilt in destroying their kin, or fighting against their friends

slokas: ॥कथं न ज्ञेयमस्माभिः पापादस्मन्निवर्तितुम् ।कुलक्षयकृतं दोषं प्रपश्यद्भ‍िर्जनार्दन ॥ ३८ ॥
slokas_translated: Should not we, whose eyes are open, who consider it to be wrong to annihilate our house, turn away from so great a crime?

slokas: कुलक्षये प्रणश्यन्ति कुलधर्माः सनातनाः ।धर्मे नष्टे कुलं कृत्स्नमधर्मोऽभिभवत्युत ॥ ३९ ॥
slokas_translated: The destruction of our kindred means the destruction of the traditions of our ancient lineage, and when these are lost, irreligion will overrun our homes.

slokas: अधर्माभिभवात्कृष्ण प्रदुष्यन्ति कुलस्त्रियः ।स्त्रीषु दुष्टासु वार्ष्णेय जायते वर्णसङ्करः ॥ ४० ॥
slokas_translated: When irreligion spreads, the women of the house begin to stray; when they lose their purity, adulteration of the stock follows.

slokas: सङ्करो नरकायैव कुलघ्न‍ानां कुलस्य च ।पतन्ति पितरो ह्येषां लुप्तपिण्डोदकक्रियाः ॥ ४१ ॥
slokas_translated: Promiscuity ruins both the family and those who defile it; while the souls of our ancestors droop, through lack of the funeral cakes and ablutions.

slokas: दोषैरेतैः कुलघ्न‍ानां वर्णसङ्करकारकैः ।उत्साद्यन्ते जातिधर्माः कुलधर्माश्च शाश्वताः ॥ ४२ ॥
slokas_translated: By the destruction of our lineage and the pollution of blood, ancient class traditions and family purity alike perish.

slokas: उत्सन्नकुलधर्माणां मनुष्याणां जनार्दन ।नरके नियतं वासो भवतीत्यनुश‍ुश्रुम ॥ ४३ ॥
slokas_translated: The wise say, my Lord, that they are forever lost, whose ancient traditions are lost.

slokas: अहो बत महत्पापं कर्तुं व्यवसिता वयम् ।यद्राज्यसुखलोभेन हन्तुं स्वजनमुद्यताः ॥ ४४ ॥
slokas_translated: Alas, it is strange that we should be willing to kill our own countrymen and commit a great sin, in order to enjoy the pleasures of a kingdom.

slokas: यदि मामप्रतीकारमशस्त्रं शस्त्रपाणयः ।धार्तराष्ट्रा रणे हन्युस्तन्मे क्षेमतरं भवेत् ॥ ४५ ॥
slokas_translated: If, on the contrary, the sons of Dhritarashtra, with weapons in their hand, should slay me, unarmed and unresisting, surely that would be better for my welfare!”

slokas: सञ्जय उवाचएवमुक्त्वार्जुनः संख्ये रथोपस्थ उपाविशत् ।विसृज्य सशरं चापं शोकसंविग्न‍मानसः ॥ ४६ ॥
slokas_translated: Sanjaya said: “Having spoken thus, in the midst of the armies, Arjuna sank on the seat of the chariot, casting away his bow and arrow; heartbroken with grief.”
